Pandava：1．PandavaThe horse of Sāma，king of Benares； his trainer was Giridanta （J．ii．98）．See Giridanta Jātaka．

2．Pandava （Pandavapabbata）A hill near Rājagaha，tinder the shadow of which the Buddha ate his meal when he begged alms in Rājagaha，soon after leaving home．J．i．66； SN．vs．414； DhA．i．85； Thag．vs．41，1167； Mtu．ii．198，etc．

It is said （SNA．ii．383f） that ascetics lived on its eastern slope．It seems formerly to have borne another name （M．iii．68）．Pandava was one of the halting-places of Sīvalī Thera when on his way to the Himālaya．AA．i．139．

3．PandavaAdjective from Pandu．E．g．，Cv．lxxxvii．29．
